jobs.toolTip: SwaggerHub has a built in OAS editor, making it easy for users to update and maintain designs. Our ability to easily create new versions, as well as reuse standardized componenent - means significant time savings when designing new changes to APIs.

jobs.description: Ensuring a design conforms to company standards
jobs.toolTip: SwaggerHub includes organization-level API Standardization which validates designs meet specified rules, as they are being written. This helps reduce the amount of manual review and validation that typically goes into an API design process.

jobs.description: Getting feedback on whether the design of an API will be problematic
jobs.toolTip: One of the key functions the SwaggerHub platform is designed around is getting and maintaining ongoing feedback from various groups. The built in commenting system reduces the need for email messages, recurring meetings, and pop-up questions by bringing the discussion to the design itself.

jobs.description: Reaching an agreement on a proposed API change
jobs.toolTip: Coming to common ground on changes that will be included in a new version is often a major challenge for teams. SwaggerHub's commenting and feedback loop provide tools that help create a structured process to getting input, and deciding when a design is ready to be published.

Providing options for clients to quickly build integrations is crucial - the more streamlined the process of working with a service, the sooner clients can get back to building the services they care about. SwaggerHub provides client SDKs to be generated in over 20 languages, with customized templates avaiable for On-Premise deployments.

jobs.description: Configuring development environments for new APIs or changes
jobs.toolTip: There are pieces of every application that are shared with each new iteration - a foundation of dependencies that a service is built on top of. SwaggerHub provides a stack of CodeGen options that allow initial stubs to be generated in multiple languages from a definition - and can even be integrated directly with source control repositories.

jobs.description: Getting requirements for upcoming changes to an API
jobs.toolTip: Nailing down changes and requirements while a service is in development can be a difficult task - things are subject to change as a design evolves. SwaggerHubs acts as a single source of truth to view and pull those changes from, making a highly iterative process a benefit, not a burden.

jobs.description: Waiting for a test environment to be shared
jobs.toolTip: SwaggerHub includes a number of powerful integrations - one of which is our Auto-Mock feature. This takes an API design and stands up a mock service to run requests against, populated with examples from the design itself. Tests can easily be built and designed using a 'living' service that reflects exactly what should be developed.

jobs.description: Updating previous tests as requirements change
jobs.toolTip: Our ReadyAPI integration allows one-click updates when using definition files, so new features and functionality can quickly be loaded into an existing test suite.

jobs.description: Creating documentation to match new APIs and versions
jobs.toolTip: SwaggerHub automatically generates API documentation as a specification changes, and hosts it in a single, easy to search API catalog.

jobs.description: Validating previous documentation matches upcoming changes
jobs.toolTip: Because SwaggerHubs documentation is directly tied to the specification, there are very few deviations possible between a design and the consumer facing documentation.

jobs.description: Making sure documentation is published and shared when a new version goes to production
jobs.toolTip: SwaggerHub has various levels of control over what is shared (or published), and what is 'live' - or a default definition in the tool. This means that while a particular version is in production, upcoming and previous definitions can be stored in parellel without confusion.
